Dear Ms. Lessnau:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and
your contract.

II. ALLEGATION
Violation
Established?
Staff person 1 pushed Youth A on 03/10/2021. Yes
Additional Findings Yes
III. METHODOLOGY
03/11/2021 Special Investigation Intake
2021C0217020

Reviewed Youth A’s medical record and incident report

03/16/2021 Exit
03/23/2021 Contact – Telephone call made
Left message for Staff person 1
Interviewed Staff person 1
ALLEGATION:
Staff person 1 and Youth A engaged in a verbal altercation and Staff person 1
pushed Youth A on 03/10/2021.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth A
I interviewed Youth A at Christ Child House on 03/12/2021. Youth A stated he was
not following directions and refused to line up to go back into the facility. Youth A
stated he stood to the side holding a basketball and Staff person 1 hit the basketball
out of his hands when Youth A walked towards the door. Youth A stated he turned
around in the doorway and Staff person 1 pushed him on his chest with one hand.
Youth A stated he entered the small playroom and sat down in a chair in the corner.
Youth A stated he told Staff person 1 that his uncle would “beat him up” when Staff
person 1 walked through the small playroom. Youth A stated he was not physically
2

injured from this incident. Youth A stated Staff person 1 “is a cool dude” and never
acted in this manner before. Youth A stated he feels safe at Christ Child House.
Staff person 1
I interviewed Staff person 1 by telephone on 03/23/2021. Staff person 1 stated Youth
A refused to step in line to enter the facility. Staff person 1 stated he “swiped the
ball” out of Youth A’s hands when Youth A cut into the line. Staff person 1 stated he
then pushed Youth A on the shoulder with one hand when Youth A turned around in
the doorway. Staff person 1 stated he asked Youth A what happened about not
following directions and Youth A threatened to have his uncle fight Staff person 1.
Staff person 1 stated he left the small playroom without further incident. Staff person
1 stated he replayed this incident in his mind on how he should have handled it. Staff
person 1 is employed at Christ Child House since 10/2019 and does not have
discipline involving youth care. His only discipline is for time and attendance.
Staff person 2
I interviewed Staff person 2 at Christ Child House on 03/12/2021. Staff person 2
stated Youth A was upset, used profanity, and refused to get in line to enter the
facility. Staff person 2 stated he directed the youths, who were lined up to enter the
building and saw Staff person 1 “slap the basketball away” from Youth A after Youth
A refused to put the basketball away. Staff person 2 stated Youth A and Staff person
1 stood face to face in the doorway, but he did not see Staff person 1 push Youth A.
Staff person 2 stated he followed the other youths into the large playroom.
Staff person 3
I interviewed Staff person 3 at Christ Child House on 03/12/2021. Staff person 3
stated she heard Youth A say “I beat your ass” to Staff person 1 and Staff person 1
responded with “Stop playing with me” as Staff person 1 walked out of the small
playroom into the large playroom. Staff person 3 stated she remained in the small
playroom with Youth A. Staff person 3 stated she did not witness Staff person 1
push Youth A.
Video review
On 03/12/2021 I reviewed the video tape of this 03/10/2021 incident. The first video
tape viewed is from outside the facility. It showed Youth A stood with a basketball in
his hands across from the other youths, who were lined up to go inside the facility. It
showed Staff person 1 hit the basketball out of Youth A’s hands when Youth A
walked towards the door in between the youth lined up and youth headed into the
facility. It showed Youth A in the doorway and Staff person 1 pushed Youth A on the
shoulder with his left hand. The second video tape viewed is from the small
playroom. It showed Staff person 1 and Youth A faced each other in the doorway. It
showed Youth A took a step back when pushed by Staff person 1. It showed Youth
A walked to the corner diagonal from the door and Staff person 1 said something to
Youth A as he walked through the small playroom with the other youths. The video
tape showed Staff person 2 walked through the small playroom with the other youths
and Staff person 3 in the small playroom during this incident.
3

Medical paperwork
Youth A went to Henry Ford Hospital Urgent Care on 03/11/2021. Bruising,
tenderness and inflammation on Youth A’s shoulder, upper chest were not found.
Incident report
Staff person 1 did not write an incident report. Youth A reported this incident and the
chief administrator wrote an incident report dated 03/11/2021. The incident report
stated Staff person 1 pushed Youth A.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Discipline.
(2) An institution shall prohibit all cruel and severe discipline,
including any of the following:
(a) Any type of corporal punishment inflicted in any manner.
ANALYSIS: Staff person 1 and Youth A’s interviews and the video tape
show Staff person 1 hit the basketball out of Youth A’s hands
and pushed Youth A with one hand on the shoulder, upper chest
area on 03/10/2021. Youth A stated he was not injured and the
medical exam confirmed no injury. It is found that Staff person 1
used physical force in disciplining Youth A.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
4

ANALYSIS: Staff person 1 did not write an incident report. Staff are
responsible in reporting and writing incidents that involve
wrongdoing on their part.
REPEAT VIOLATION from 2020C0420016
(This is a repeat rule violation, but 2020C0420016 was not for
failure to write an incident report.)
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
The continuance of a first provisional license is recommended upon receipt of an
approved corrective action plan.
